title: Is there a boneless fish? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s a tiny fish, probably a baby smelt that’s called “White Rice Fish” (translation of it’s Cantonese name) that’s consumed all over South East Asia and probably China. It can be purchased in most Asian food markets in frozen packages. These fish do have bones but the fish and it’s bones are so soft and tiny that the entire fish can be eaten whole, it’s the closest to being truly boneless fish that I know of. It’s usually made into an omelette with eggs or it’s deep fried with salt and pepper.
